data.title: Meggitt acquires electronics firm
data.meta_description: DORSET aerospace and engineering group Meggitt has acquired Croster Electronics for an undisclosed sum to boost its electronics business.
data.text:
Croster Electronics trades in the UK under the Neohm brand. The Oldham firm is a major supplier of resistive products to the industrial, instrumentation, computer and telecoms markets.

Its main distribution route to market in the UK is with RS Components.

The marketing of Neohm products has been pursued through distribution and direct sales since the inception of the company in 1974.

Several clients have regularly been supplied with Neohm resistors for more than 20 years.

Croster Electronics Ltd has been acquired by Wimborne-based Meggitt's electronic components subsidiary, which manufactures parts for control knobs and switches.

The intention is to widen the range of products on offer to customers of both companies.

Meggitt Electronic Components managing director Alex Burns said: "This is an important acquisition of a leading and specialist resistor supplier."

The acquisition "fully complements our strategy of building on our resistive supply capability, while further developing our relationships in catalogue distribution," he added.

Meggitt Electronic Components manufactures a broad range of resistive devices. Its range includes potentiometers, switches and a variety of sensors.

Meggitt Electronic Components also designs and manufactures for the automotive industry. Its auto products include include fuel level sensors.
